name: gcr.io/oss-fuzz/test-project
args:
rm -r /out && cd /src && cd /src && mkdir -p /workspace/out/coverage && compile || (echo "********************************************************************************
Coverage build failed.
To reproduce, run:
python infra/helper.py build_image test-project
python infra/helper.py build_fuzzers --sanitizer coverage test-project
********************************************************************************" && false)

name: gcr.io/oss-fuzz-base/base-runner
args:
for f in /corpus/*.zip; do unzip -q $f -d ${f%%.*} || (echo "Failed to unpack the corpus for $(basename ${f%%.*}). This usually means that corpus backup for a particular fuzz target does not exist. If a fuzz target was added in the last 24 hours, please wait one more day. Otherwise, something is wrong with the fuzz target or the infrastructure, and corpus pruning task does not finish successfully." && exit 1); done && coverage || (echo "********************************************************************************
Code coverage report generation failed.
To reproduce, run:
python infra/helper.py build_image test-project
python infra/helper.py build_fuzzers --sanitizer coverage test-project
python infra/helper.py coverage test-project
********************************************************************************" && false)
